page.title: 20Health in Plympton
page.content: Some children from{Plympton St {Maurice Primary School}interviewed{Dr {Campbell.}He said that it would be nice to have a hospital in Plympton. Some people would go to hospital because they have nobody to look after them. Others would go if they had broken their arm, so they could have an X-Ray. He suggested that the{Health {Authority}would not allow a hospital since we are so close to Plymouth. He told us that the main diseases children suffered from were tonsilitis and bronchitis. He saw a lot of sore throats, tummy upsets and athletes foot. Some children suffer from bed wetting problems, or do not want to go to school. He said that there was plenty to keep the doctors busy, but luckily there are{antibiotics}to help the fight against bugs. {Christoper Prescot - 11
